str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
This; he, she, it.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To increase, multiply. From another form of plethos; to increase.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of Hellen; a Hellenist or Greek-speaking Jew.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Murmuring, grumbling. From gogguzo; a grumbling.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A Hebrew, particularly one who speaks Hebrew (Aramaic). From Eber; a Hebrew or Jew.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Feminine of a presumed derivative apparently from the base of chasma through the idea of deficiency; a widow, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To look past, overlook, neglect. From para and theoreo; to overlook or disregard.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Daily, day-by-day. From kata and hemera; quotidian.
Waiting at table; in a wider sense: service, ministration. From diakonos; attendance; figuratively aid, service.
